content.question: In lines 34-36 (“The sun . . . river”), the changes that occur in the setting surrounding the river most clearly serve to establish the

choices.label: long-awaited arrival of the sun after a night of Pan’s destructive actions
calming influence that nature has had on Pan’s originally agitated behavior
hypnotic beauty of Pan’s music in comparison to his earlier activities
everlasting life of Pan and the gods in comparison to the short life of the reed

content.answer: hypnotic beauty of Pan’s music in comparison to his earlier activities

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain the function of setting in a narrative.
